content.description: Crux is moving from an okay right hand pinch to a far, hidden crimp with left hand. (Top out hold for Crimps N Slots is OFF). Top out is same as Marco Polo.
content.location: Start with right hand in an undercling pocket and left hand around the arete on a bad hold.

content.description: Crux is reaching out left to sloper, pretty reachy move, clean topout though.
content.location: Start on jug on the right of the boulder. Shares start with High Tensions. Trend up and left with some high feet.

content.description: Starts on the jug and moves through side-pulls and crimps to the top jug. A little scary towards top because the fall isn't as clean as you're partially over another small boulder. Fun movement nonetheless.
Start low and left with a bad left hand and better right hand crimp sidepull. Make 1-2 moves to join "Crimps N Slots". This just eliminates the traverse.
content.location: Lower left side of the boulder. Start directly below the first top out ledge.

content.description: Traverse left through slots and then straight up before hitting the arete. Top out on the first ledge (not Marco Polo top out).
content.location: Start on the right, with the jug, shared by High Tensions and Marco Polo.

content.description: Nice boulder, with some low grade climbs. It has a decent landing (slightly downhill) but the landing leads into a not too busy road. Still have a spotter to keep you off the road on any falls. Similar to the traversing problem Crimps N Slots, you can add extensions by traversing from the left, linking into other climbs for more time on the wall but probably doesn't change grade by much.Just some fun local climbs worth checking out.
